facts.1: National Gingerbread House Day is celebrated on December 12th to honor the tradition of making and decorating gingerbread houses during the holiday season.
facts.2: The tradition of making gingerbread houses dates back to the 16th century in Germany, inspired by the fairy tale of Hansel and Gretel.
facts.3: The day encourages families and friends to come together and create their own gingerbread houses, using candies, icing, and other decorations.

facts.1: National Poinsettia Day is observed on December 12th to celebrate the poinsettia plant, a popular symbol of the holiday season.
facts.2: The day commemorates the death of Joel Roberts Poinsett, the first U.S. ambassador to Mexico, who introduced the poinsettia to the United States in the 1820s.
facts.3: Poinsettias are native to Mexico and are known for their vibrant red and green foliage, making them a popular decoration during Christmas.

facts.1: International Day of Neutrality is observed on December 12th to promote the importance of neutrality in international relations and diplomacy.
facts.2: The day was established by the United Nations General Assembly in 2017 to highlight the role of neutrality in maintaining peace and security.
facts.3: The day encourages countries to adopt neutral policies and engage in diplomatic efforts to resolve conflicts and promote international cooperation.
